definition: a genius in retrospect (idiom); hindsight is 20-20
wise after the event (idiom); with hindsight, one should have predicted it

sentences.english: It's much cheaper to anticipate rather than respond.

sentences.english: I don't think Yogi Chen made any comments about it, then or after it was over.

sentences.english: Taking preventive action beforehand and remedial action afterwards are the two common methods of warding off taboos.

sentences.english: In such situations, talent becomes clearly defined only after the fact.

sentences.english: What a shame, soon after i have known from the newspaper that the result of this match is one to one.

sentences.english: Gazing afterward at the large, silver trophy, Mr. Boylan felt emotional.

definition: as for/as to/to go so far as to
after drinking/under the influence of alcohol
to deal with the aftermath (arising from an accident)/funeral arrangements/reparations
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
in a little while/in a moment/later on
